document_data.name: ''Shield of the Undevout''
document_data.mainbody:
The '''''Shield of the Undevout''''' was an ornate [[enchanted]] [[shield]] that was once wielded by a [[blackguard]] and later by a [[death knight]] they became.

{{quote|''Where once this shield would protect the rallying forces of good - now it pushes them back, crushing them against their allies until they pop.''}}
document_data.Powers: The ''Shield of the Undevout'' possessed a ''+2'' protective enchantment. Additionally, it had the ''dreadful hewer'' enchantment that made the wielder's spells and abilities that caused ''[[fear]]'' dramatically easy to take hold of the opponents' hearts. Lastly, the shield also expanded the wielder's magical capabilities, allowing them to memorize one additional simple spell of an [[arcane]] of [[divine]] nature.
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, ''blackguard's greaves'' were worn by the guardian death knight called [[That Which Guards]], who, along with [[That Which Guards]] and [[That Which Lurks (death knight)|That Which Lurks]], guarded the entrance to the chamber of the [[Bhaalist]] [[Murder Tribunal]] in the [[Undercellar]] of [[Baldur's Gate]].
